https://doi.org/10.7927/H4WM1BB7.Description: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) Socio-Economic Baseline Dataset consists of population, human development, economic, water resources, land cover, land use, agriculture, food, energy, and biodiversity data. This dataset was collated by IPCC from a variety of sources such as The World Bank, United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), and Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and is distributed by the Columbia University Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN).

https://doi.org/10.7927/9ryj-6467.Description: The VIIRS Plus DMSP Change in Lights VIIRS-DMSP dLIGHT v1 dataset shows changes in brightness and extent of global nighttime lights networks over two decades. These data may aid in urbanization research.

https://doi.org/10.7927/yzp7-sm30.Description: The INFORM Global Risk Index identifies the countries at a high risk of humanitarian crisis that are more likely to require international assistance. The INFORM Global Risk Index (GRI) model is based on risk concepts published in the scientific literature and envisages three dimensions of risk: Hazard, Exposure, Vulnerability, and Lack of Coping Capacity. The INFORM GRI model is split into different levels to provide a quick overview of the underlying factors leading to humanitarian risk. The INFORM GRI model supports a proactive crisis management framework and will be helpful for an objective allocation of resources for disaster management as well as for coordinated actions focused on anticipating, mitigating, and preparing for humanitarian emergencies. Only the two main sections, Vulnerability and Lack of Coping Capacity, not the Hazard & Exposure section, were used in the IPCC AR6.
https://doi.org/10.7927/yzp7-sm30.Project: IPCC - Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

https://doi.org/10.7927/5bbs-e174.Description: The Natural Resource Protection and Child Health Indicators, 2021 Release dataset provides indicators of natural resource protection and child health. The Natural Resource Protection Indicator (NRPI) and Child Health Indicator (CHI) are based on proximity-to-target scores, ranging from 0 to 100, at target. The NRPI covers 135 countries and is calculated based on the weighted average percentage of biomes under protected status. The CHI is a composite index for 194 countries derived from the average of three proximity-to-target scores for access to at least basic water and sanitation, along with child mortality.

https://doi.org/10.7927/k9t6-gh59.Description: The Global Development Potential Indices (DPIs) dataset contains thirteen sector-level DPIs for sectors related to renewable energy, concentrated solar power, photovoltaic solar, wind, hydropower, fossil fuels, coal, conventional and unconventional oil and gas, mining (metallic, non-metallic), and agriculture (crop, biofuels expansion). These data may be useful in conservation, urban development, and environmental justice research.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H44T6G9K.Description: The Gridded Subset of Subnational Poverty and Extreme Poverty Prevalence dataset provides poverty levels in the coastal zone of West Africa. Poverty levels affect the defenselessness of populations in the low elevation coastal zone.
https://doi.org/10.7927/H44T6G9K.Project: WACVM - West Africa Coastal Vulnerability Mapping

https://doi.org/10.7927/H42V2D1C.Description: The Global Gridded Geographically Based Economic Data (GEcon) dataset provides global gridded Gross Domestic Product (GDP) data in both Market Exchange Rate (MER) and Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) to be used for socioeconomic, environmental, climate, and other related research.
https://doi.org/10.7927/H42V2D1C.Format: ASCII, PDF, PNG, XLS, CSV, KML, TXT
https://doi.org/10.7927/H42V2D1C.Project: GEcon - Global Gridded Geographically Based Economic Data

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4VD6WCT.Description: The Global Roads Open Access Data Set, gROADS, v1 (1980-2010) dataset provides a global dataset of roads between settlements. These data may aid in urban planning and evacuation route planning.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4K64G12.Description: The Global Subnational Prevalence of Child Malnutrition dataset shows the percentage of underweight children under the age of five. These data can aid in poverty and environmental health research.

https://dx.doi.org/10.7927/H45X26V8.Description: The Unsatisfied Basic Needs dataset provides subnational estimates of unsatisfied basic needs, such as adequate housing, water, electricity, sanitation, education, and employment, for various countries in Latin America. These data may be useful in urban planning and environmental public health research.
https://dx.doi.org/10.7927/H45X26V8.Geographic_Coverage: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua, Peru

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4PZ56R2.Description: The Global Subnational Infant Mortality Rates dataset provides a global subnational map of infant mortality rate estimates. These data may be useful in health, poverty, and environmental studies.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4FF3Q9B.Description: The Poverty and Food Security Case Studies dataset provides subnational estimates of poverty and food security for interdisciplinary studies of poverty, food security, and the environment. The dataset includes small area estimates of poverty, inequality, food security, and related measures for subnational administrative units in Mexico, Ecuador, Kenya, Malawi, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nigeria, and Vietnam. These data may aid in food availability and access research.
https://doi.org/10.7927/H4FF3Q9B.Geographic_Coverage: Mexico, Ecuador, Kenya, Malawi, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nigeria, Vietnam

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4HQ3WTH.Description: The Global 15 x 15 Minute Grids of the Downscaled Population Based on the SRES B2 Scenario dataset provides country-level population data based on the SRES B2 marker scenario. These data may aid in urban planning and other social research.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4XW4GQ1.Description: The Country-Level GDP and Downscaled Projections dataset provides data on country-level GDP per capita and downscaled projections based on the SRES A1, A2, B1, & B2 marker scenarios. These data may be useful in socioeconomic research.
